summary:
Venezuela, officially the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, is a South American country on the Caribbean Sea. It covers 916,445 square kilometers and has around 29 million people. Caracas is the capital and largest city.

Spain colonized Venezuela in 1522, and it gained independence in 1830. The country has faced political ups and downs, including democratic governments and military dictatorships. Economic crises in the 1980s and 1990s led to social unrest and a shift towards an authoritarian regime.

Venezuela is known for its vast oil reserves, but poor economic management has caused severe issues. The country now struggles with hyperinflation, shortages, and a refugee crisis.
title: Venezuela
